msContents.summary:
I) Taʾāmra Māryām "Miracles of Mary" (fols. 3ra-44va) I-1) Maṣḥafa śǝrʿāt, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah (fols. 3ra-6rb) I-2) Introductory exhortation and hymns (fols. 6va-8va) I-3) ʾƎsaggǝd laki wa-ʾǝweddǝsaki ... "I worship Thee ..." (fols. 8va-9va) I-4) Taʾāmra Māryām "Miracles of Mary": 47 miracles (fols. 9va-44va), incomplete II) Taʾāmra ʾIyasus "Miracles of Jesus" (fols. 45ra-66vb) II-1) ʾƎsaggǝd la-malakotǝka ... "I worship Thy Godhead ..." (fols. 45ra-47rb) II-2) Taʾāmra ʾIyasus "Miracles of Jesus": 12 miracles (fols. 47rb-66vb) III) Taʾāmra Mikāʾel Miracles of Michael": 2 miracles (fols. 66vb-68ra) IV) Taʾāmra Gabra Manfas Qǝddus "Miracles of Gabra Manfas Qǝddus": 1 miracle (fol. 68ra-vb)
Additio 1.

msItem.note: - ʾO-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝyä Māryām ʾǝmmu la-ʾǝgziʾǝnä ʾIyasus Krǝstos kahāli ... "O my Lady Mary, Mother of our Lord Jesus Christ the Almighty ..." (7va-8ra) (cp. ChRep n373)
- salām laki ʾo-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝyä Māryām ʾǝmma madḫǝn wa-ʾǝmma bǝrhān ... "Salutation to you, o my Lady, Virgin Mary, Mother of the Saviour and Mother of the Light ..." (8ra-va).
The miracles of Mary (Texts I-4) are numbered. The miracles of Jesus (Text II-2) are erroneously numbered.

supportDesc.condition: The manuscript is worn. The leather cover is torn off from both boards (only turn-ins are preserved; traces of leather are visible on the front board). The back board is broken and repaired. The Ms. was resewn. The sewing has been repaired with synthetic threads.

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling (sometimes below the ruling: 7rv, 17r-19v, 46rv, 63v-64v, 68v).
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The scribe did not use the bottom ruled line on 4r-7v, 67rv.
Some fols. have an additional crudely ruled line in the bottom margin (3rv, 9r, 16rv, 49r-49v, 65v).

Mediocre, irregular Black, red Gabra MāryāmGabra Māryām is mentioned as the scribe in supplications on 42vb, 66vb and in Additio 1.First half of the 19th century (?)
ለዓ፡ ዓለ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., 14ra, 25ra,25vb, 30vb)
ለዓለመ፡ ዓ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., e.g., 14va, 29ra)
Nomina sacra; names of the donors; groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts I-1, I-2 and II-1; incipit of all other texts; two initial lines of sections of Texts I-4,II-2, III; some section numbers of Texts I-4, II-2; word ʾǝsaggǝd "I worship" in Texts I-3 and II-1; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

It is difficult to determine whether one or more scribes were involved in writing because the handwriting appears irregular throughout the Ms. Probably the text was written by one hand at several stages (see irregularities between 16v-17r, 44v-45r).

decoDesc.decoNote: 3r (incipit page of Text I-1): coloured (red, brown, black) ornamental band; geometric motifs.
6v (incipit page of Text I-2): coloured (red, brown, black) ornamental band; geometric motifs.
45r (incipit page of Text II-1): coloured (red, yellow, black) ornamental frame; geometric motifs.

Coloured ornamental bands with different motifs and colours are drawn throughout Texts I-4 and II-2 dividing some of the sections (9va, 11ra, 13ra, 14ra, 17va, 27va, 33va, 39rb, 41va, 42ra, 43va, 44rb, 47ra, 58va, 68rb).

Fol. 22v: The Virgin and Child.Legend: ሥዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወወልዳ፡ "Image of our Lady Mary". ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ሚካኤል፡ "Image of Saint Michael". ሥዕለ፡ ገብርኤል፡ "Image of Gabriel". The miniature, painted on unruled leaf, is protected by a textile curtain. It is most probably copied from Ms. MKMG-006.

Fol. 23r: (above) The Trinity; (below) the seven Archangels.Legend: ፫ሥላሴ፡ "Trinity". ሰብአቱ፡ ሊቃነ፡ መላእክት፡ "Seven Archangels". Painted on unruled leaf. The miniature is most probably copied from Ms. MKMG-006.

item.note: The note, written in the main hand in red ink, states that the Ms. was commissioned and donated to the church of Mikāʾel ʾAraʾro by the priests Tasfā ʾIyasus, Takla Hāymānot, Rǝʾǝsä Hāymānot and "their father" Gabra Krǝstos. The note mentions also the name of the scribe Gabra Māryām.

list.item: - Rubrication has been executed later. Rubricated words are often written only in parts (e.g. ማርያ instead of ማርያም or ሚካ instead of ሚካኤል. - Spaces for rubricated names and passages are left unfilled: 20ra, 44va, 54vb. - Long passages omitted in the text are written in the margins: 56v, 66va, 67ra. - Erasures marked with (crossed) lines: 29va, 33va, 42ra or in a frame: 39rb. - Erroneously written word crossed out: 11ra.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards (the back board is broken and repaired), covered with reddish brown tooled leather (now for the most part missinh). Two pairs of sewing stations.
Small holes and tears are visible at the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and the tail of the codex.

person.persName: According to Additio 1, the Ms. was commissioned and donated by the priests Tasfā ʾIyasus, Takla Hāymānot and Rǝʾǝsä Hāymānot. Their names are written in supplication formulas (but here the name of Tasfā Mikāʾel is written instead of Tasfā ʾIyasus).
